snippet: Saudi Arabia, a strong ally of the United States, was said to be frustrated by policy setbacks over Syria, Iran and Palestinian statehood and did not submit a written statement in lieu of a speech.
abstract: Saudi Arabia, frustrated by what it apparently regards as policy setbacks over Syria, Iran and Palestinian statehood, abruptly cancels its turn to speak at the annual United Nations General Assembly meeting; incident marks first time nation has relinquished chance to speak on world affairs.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia, a strong ally of the United States, was said to be frustrated by policy setbacks over Syria, Iran and Palestinian statehood and did not submit a written statement in lieu of a speech.

headline.main: In a First, Saudis Cancel a Speech at the U.N.
headline.print_headline: In a First, Saudis Cancel a Speech at the U.N.
